flawed_nl_solution:
The cost of the 200 employees is 200 employees * $12/employee/hour = $<<200*12=2400>>2400 per hour.
The cost of the 40 employees is 40 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<40*14=560>>560 per hour.
The rest means 300 employees - 200 employees - 40 employees = <<300-200-40=70>>70 employees.
These 70 employees' employment costs are at 70 employees * $17/employee/hour = $<<70*17=1190>>1190 per hour.
So in total all employees earn $2400/hour + $560/hour + $1190/hour = $4150/hour.
During an 8-hour shift, this cost would be at 8 hours * $4150/hour = $<<8*4150=33200>>33200.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 70. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
